listitem.para: SETCURSORNOWAIT changes the cursor to the familiar arrow shape. This should be just before a call to YIELD.

Once MSWLogo is set to yield, the appropriate (non-hourglass) cursor will be used on the next event involving the cursor (like moving the mouse), regardless of if you call SETCURSORNOWAIT. However, calling SETCURSORNOWAIT will show the arrow cursor without waiting for the next event.

programlisting.userinput: REPEAT 100 [ NOYIELD SETCURSORWAIT REPEAT 100 [ ; (work to be done) ] SETCURSORNOWAIT YIELD ]
